programme.title: The Horse Tamer With Pat Parelli
programme.desc: Pat lends his expertise to professional Show Jumper, Candace King and works with Harley to bring about respect, try, and understanding so that he can ultimately face jumps with confidence.

programme.title: Animal River Challenge
programme.desc: Rainer Bergmaz travels to the heart of Guyana's Hinterland to find the shy and rare black caiman crocodile.

programme.title: River Jaws

programme.title: Primeval New Zealand
programme.desc: Peter Elliott reveals new information about the origins New Zealands 'evolutionary mutants'.

programme.title: A New Prehistory

programme.desc: New fossils in China reveal prehistoric feathered beasts and giant insects, including large dragonflies.

programme.desc: China fossils show prehistoric mammals evolved 35 million years ago, with more diversity and abundance.

programme.title: Myths of the Great White
programme.desc: The great white shark is one of the world's most vilified predators. Its maligned public image arises from occasionally attacking humans, but more importantly by its popular portrayal as a man-eater.

programme.desc: Chester, a top carriage driver, is struggling with his powerful horse, Kasper, whose strong will and impatience could put the team at risk.

programme.title: The Horse Tamer With Pat Parelli
programme.desc: Grace bought her quarterhorse Bella specifically for riding, but Bella doesn't seem to want anyone to ride. Pat is here to help Grace and to make Bella feel safer for generations of Grace's family.

programme.desc: Fred Boyle, a free diver, shares his father's passion, using a mirror to spot ocean giants and study them.

programme.desc: Fred, a marine biologist, studies whale sharks in Indonesia, aiding a global survey while managing fears.

programme.desc: Michael's connection with wild animals on his Emo property helped him heal his soul after a tragic event
